To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. The LORD hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend thee;<RF>defend…: Heb. set thee on an high place<Rf>
Send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion;<RF>thee help: Heb. thy help<Rf><RF>strengthen: Heb. support<Rf>
Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.<RF>accept: Heb. turn to ashes: or, make fat<Rf>
Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.
We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up <FI>our<Fi> banners: the LORD fulfil all thy petitions.<CM>

Now know I that the LORD saveth his anointed; he will hear him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.<RF>his holy…: Heb. the heaven of his holiness<Rf><RF>with…: Heb. by the strength of the salvation of<Rf>
Some <FI>trust<Fi> in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the LORD our God.
They are brought down and fallen: but we are risen, and stand upright.
Save, LORD: let the king hear us when we call.<CM>
